column1: #Text=> [DC-ShadowNet: Single-Image Hard and Soft Shadow Removal Using
#Text=conda install pytorch=1.10.2 torchvision torchaudio cudatoolkit=11.3 -c pytorch
#Text=   The LRSS dataset contains 134 shadow images (62 pairs of shadow and shadow-free images).
#Text=   We use 34 pairs for testing and 100 shadow images for training.
#Text=   For shadow-free training images, 28 from LRSS and 72 randomly selected from the USR dataset.
#Text=## Pre-trained Models and Shadow Removal Results: [[Dropbox]](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/346iirg55e1qnir/AADqxEu8vyj4KfKR0wOfELjKa?
#Text=| Dataset  | Model Dropbox | Model BaiduPan | Model Put in Path| Results Dropbox | Results BaiduPan |
#Text=Put the test images in `test_input`, results in: `results/output/`

#Text=Get the following Figure 5 in the main paper, VGG feature visualization [results](.

#Text=The root mean squared error (RMSE) [evaluation code](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-lG8nAJbWajAC4xopx7hGPKbuwYRw4x-/view) used by all methods (including ours) computes mean absolute error (MAE).
